thread.title: Frances Cappuccini Caesarean death caused by hospital failures
thread.title_full: Frances Cappuccini Caesarean death caused by hospital failures

title: Frances Cappuccini Caesarean death caused by hospital failures
text:
Frances Cappuccini Caesarean death caused by hospital failures 16 January 2017 Image copyright PA Image caption Frances Cappuccini died at Tunbridge Wells Hospital in October 2012 The death of a woman following childbirth was a result of "failures, inadequate diagnosis and treatment", a coroner has ruled. 
Frances Cappuccini suffered a fatal haemorrhage at Tunbridge Wells Hospital after an emergency Caesarean in 2012. 
The inquest previously heard the doctor caring for Mrs Cappuccini had made a mistake seven months earlier. 
The original NHS report into her death stated another woman had suffered a haemorrhage in Dr Nadeem Azeez's care.
